description.value: The Abbot casts Guiding Bolt and then casts another spell (other than Guiding Bolt).

A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 4d6]] radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by [[/r 1d6]] for each slot level above 1st.
An Elite creature counts as two monsters of a given level. It has +2 to all saves, as well as twice as many hit points and twice as much damage as a typical monster of its level.

Stretching your hand towards a fallen ally, you command your ally to return to life to aid you, if only for a moment.

1 Action - 1 Creature (30 ft.) - 4th Level -VS - Concentration (1 Minute)*

Your target must be willing to return to life, and must not have been dead for more than 1 hour.

Healing Spell

Your target is immediately returned to life with half their hit point maximum. They take their turn immediately after yours. They are in full control of their actions. If you lose concentration on this spell, or a minute passes, they return to death.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the chosen creature can remain for up to 1 hour. If you cast this spell at 8th level or higher, they can remain for 24 hours.

This spell does not restore lost limbs, and so a target's body may not be in good enough condition to be raised.

description.chatFlavor: The number of hit points restored is equal to half the target's hit point maximum

description.value:
You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 1d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.13jgvfPYMKhD6ItV]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.jEiJoIpjARffen1E]{Deafened}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.snxaPrE0HxC1z3Bs]{Paralyzed}, or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.8zsqV5YOeH9l3ojb]{Poisoned}.

This spell bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends. If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spells ends.

A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to [[/r 3d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 1d8]] for each slot level above 5th.

While worn without any other pieces of plate armor, a breastplate consists of a single piece of plate mail that covers the torso. It is usually worn with padded or leather underneath to provide padding and some protection to the parts of the body the breastplate doesn't cover.

Large shields can be made of metal or wood, and provide substantial protection to those carrying them. They typically extend to cover one flank of the creature carrying them, though they are not so large that they hinder movement. Unlike with small shields, the wielder of a large shield has little to no ability to manipulate objects with the shield hand.

You can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore 50 hit points.

Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.

activation.condition: The target cannot be Undead or a Construct
